author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Landis Canada Records First Goal as Missouri Falls to Miami 2-1
text:
Landis Canada Records First Goal as Missouri Falls to Miami 2-1
In their latest match,
University of Missouri soccer suffered a 2-1 defeat to Miami, despite a standout performance from freshman Landis Canada, who scored her first career goal. The Tigers were down 2-0 when Canada managed to convert a header from a corner kick in the 69th minute, cutting the deficit but unable to find the equalizer before the final whistle. Miami secured their win with goals scored in the 39th and 49th minutes. Although Missouri dominated shots on goal, they struggled to capitalize on their offensive opportunities.
- Missouri outshot Miami 12 to 6.
- The Tigers had 5 shots on goal compared to Miami's 4.
- Missouri's current season record stands at 1-3-1.
- The team will have a bye week before facing SEMO on Sept. 8.
Following their bye week, Missouri will seek to recover with a matchup against SEMO, aiming to improve their season record and build on recent performances.Bottom Line
Despite a solid individual showing from Canada, the Tigers need to convert on scoring opportunities if they hope to turn their season around against SEMO.
